Description.Name: MRB Authorization Upgrade Available
Description.Details: As you are on the way from your personal quarters towards the bridge, Darius catches up to you from a side corridor. After a brief salute he shows you his techpad without comment, once again displaying a message from the MRB. "Dear Commander {COMMANDER.Name} of {COMPANY.CompanyName}, It is with great pleasure the MRB can inform You that Your company is now able to request an increased contract classification authorization within the MRB contract bidding system. For a small nominal fee, the MRB will provide one of its most experienced assessors; who after a routine assessment of your company's capabilities will allow the requisition of an upgraded official MRB Omega Authorization Console. This upgrade will allow Your company to take on the hardest of contracts, opening the path to ultimate glory and fortunes! We hope to hear from you shortly, [TEMPLATE_Generic_Insert Name of Friendly Local MRB Representative]." You look up at Darius after you finished reading the message."Darius, I am not sure I want to suffer through that horrible experience again, I am still having nightmares of the last assessment..."Darius nods in reply."I figured as much, Commander. I will leave the decision up to you" Information: The access to Superheavy Hunt contracts can now be unlocked. These missions are amongst the hardest, as they will include several Superheavy 'Mechs or vehicles, which each can weigh up to 200 tons.

Description.Name: <color=#A8A8A8>[Delay 180 days]</color> Pass on the opportunity for now.
Nothing happens, temporary delay the decision for 6 months.
Description.Details:
<color=#A8A8A8>You decide you are not ready to suffer through the assessment again, passing on the opportunity for now.</color>

<color=#35dde0>[Event has been paused for 180 days]</color>

Description.Name: Send a request for a MRB Assessor
Assessment
Description.Details: <color=#A8A8A8>You sigh heavily before deciding the suffering will still be worth it in the end. Time to call for that MRB Assessor again.</color>
